intro: Rhynchospora leucocarpa, commonly known as the white-fruited flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typically found in wet or marshy environments. The fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in aquatic or semi-aquatic settings.
